SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.customcomponents.tileview

Class TileSubjectView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.customcomponents.tileview.TileSubjectView
All Implemented Interfaces:
MyShelfieComponent, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class TileSubjectView extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane implements MyShelfieComponent
Represents a graphical view of a tile subject in the game. This class extends the JavaFX `Pane` class and implements the `MyShelfieComponent` interface. It provides methods to handle the visualization and interaction with a tile subject.
Since:
08/06/2023
Version:
3.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

      private void onMouseEnteredHandler(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Event handler triggered when the mouse enters the component. If the component is not clicked or disabled, it applies the highlight effect.

      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggering the event.

    • onMouseExitedHandler

      private void onMouseExitedHandler(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Event handler triggered when the mouse exits the component. If the component is not clicked or disabled, it resets to default decorations.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggering the event.

    • onMousePressedHandler

      protected void onMousePressedHandler(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Event handler triggered when the mouse is pressed on the component. If the component is not disabled, it applies the appropriate decoration based on the clicked state. It also toggles the clicked state.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggering the event.

    • changeParent

      private void changeParent(javafx.scene.layout.Pane newParent)
      Changes the parent of the component to the specified newParent. Removes the component from the current parent, resets the interaction state, sets the new parent, and resets the decorations to default.
      Parameters:
      newParent - The new parent pane to set.

    • changeParent

      public void changeParent(javafx.scene.layout.Pane newParent, double x, double y)
      Changes the parent of the component to the specified newParent, and sets the translation coordinates. If the component is not disabled and not clicked, it calls the changeParent method, sets the translation coordinates, and updates the visual position of the component.
      Parameters:
      newParent - The new parent pane to set.
      x - The x-coordinate translation.
      y - The y-coordinate translation.

    • setCurrentState

      protected void setCurrentState(TileSubjectViewState currentState)
      Sets the current state of the TileSubjectView to the specified currentState.
      Parameters:
      currentState - The new current state to set.

    • performAction

      public void performAction(javafx.scene.layout.Pane... panes)
      Performs the action associated with the current state of the TileSubjectView. If the component is not disabled, it sets the clicked state to false, calls the tileStateAction method of the current state passing the component and the specified panes, and resets the decorations to default.
      Parameters:
      panes - The panes to pass to the tileStateAction method.

    • reverseAction

      public void reverseAction()
      Reverses the action associated with the current state of the TileSubjectView. If the component is not disabled, it sets the clicked state to false and calls the reverseStateAction method of the current state passing the component.

    • toOpponentBookShelf

      public void toOpponentBookShelf(javafx.scene.layout.Pane... panes)
      Moves the TileSubjectView to the opponent's bookshelf by performing the action associated with the opponent's state. Sets the component as disabled and clicked to false, updates the current state to TileViewInOpponent, calls the tileStateAction method of the current state passing the component and the specified panes, and resets the decorations to default.
      Parameters:
      panes - The panes to pass to the tileStateAction method.

    • disable

      public void disable()
      Disables the TileSubjectView by setting the disabled flag to true and applying the MyShelfieObscured decoration. If the component is not already disabled, it disables the component and applies the decoration.

    • disableClick

      public void disableClick()
      method to disable click

    • setClickable

      public void setClickable()
      Sets the TileSubjectView as clickable by resetting the interaction state and decorations. If the component is disabled, it resets the interaction state and decorations to make it clickable again.

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled()
      Checks if the TileSubjectView is enabled or disabled.
      Returns:
      true if the component is enabled, false if it is disabled.

    • createToSmallerPathTransition

      Creates a transition animation to scale down the TileSubjectView and move it along a path to the specified destination panes.
      Parameters:
      destinationPanes - The destination panes to move the component towards.
      Returns:
      The transition animation.
